questions.oldquestion: When you took out your current mortgage - how much did you initially borrow?
questions.newquestion: How much did you borrow when you first took out your mortgage?
questions.hinttext: You can find this on your offer letter or your most recent mortgage statement. Choose the option that's closest to the amount you borrowed.
questions.option6: I do not have a mortgage

questions.oldquestion: In which year did you open your loan?
questions.newquestion: When did you take out a loan?
questions.hinttext: Think about any personal (or 'unsecured') loans you might have. Hire purchase agreements, second mortgages and home credit loans do not count as personal loans.
questions.option6: I've never taken out a loan

questions.oldquestion: How much was your recent loan for?
questions.newquestion: How much did you borrow when you last took out a loan?
questions.hinttext:
Think about any personal (or 'unsecured') loans you might have. Hire purchase agreements, second mortgages and home credit loans do not count as personal loans.

Choose the option that's closest to the amount you originally borrowed.
questions.option6: I've never taken out a loan

questions.oldquestion: How much is your monthly loan payment?
questions.newquestion: How much of your loan do you pay back every month?
questions.hinttext:
Think about any personal (or 'unsecured') loans you might have. Hire purchase agreements, second mortgages and home credit loans do not count as personal loans. 

Choose the option that's closest to the amount you're meant to pay back every month. You can find this in your loan agreement.
questions.option6: I've never taken out a loan

questions.oldquestion: What is the limit on your credit card?
questions.newquestion: What's the credit limit on your credit card?
questions.hinttext:
This is the maximum amount you can borrow on your credit card.

You can find your credit limit on your credit card statement.
questions.option6: I do not have a credit card

questions.oldquestion: In which month and year did you open your mobile phone contract
questions.newquestion: When did you take out your mobile phone contract?
questions.hinttext: Think about who your own phone contract is with instead of your work phone, if you have one.

questions.oldquestion: How much is your monthly or most recent gas bill?
questions.newquestion: How much is your gas bill?
questions.hinttext: Choose the option that's closest to your most recent gas bill or the amount you usually pay each month.

questions.oldquestion: What is the outstanding balance of your current mortgage?
questions.newquestion: How much do you have left to pay on your mortgage?
questions.hinttext: You can find this on your most recent mortgage statement. Choose the option that's closest to the amount you have left to pay including any interest.
questions.option6: I do not have a mortgage

questions.oldquestion: What is the balance of your buy to let mortgage?
questions.newquestion: How much do you have left to pay on your buy-to-let mortgage?
questions.hinttext: You can find this on your most recent mortgage statement. Choose the option that's closest to the amount you have left to pay including any interest.
questions.option6: I do not have a buy-to-let mortgage

questions.oldquestion: What is the balance including interest of your loan?
questions.newquestion: How much of your loan do you have left to pay back?
questions.hinttext:
Think about any personal (or 'unsecured') loans you might have. Hire purchase agreements, second mortgages and home credit loans do not count as personal loans. 

Choose the option that's closest to the amount you have to pay back including any interest.
questions.option6: I've never taken out a loan

questions.oldquestion: In which month and year did you open your current account?
questions.newquestion: When did you open your current account?
questions.hinttext: Think about your current account instead of any joint, business or saving accounts you might have.

questions.oldquestion: How much do you pay to your student loan each month?
questions.newquestion: How much of your student loan did you pay back last month?
questions.hinttext: You can find this on your payslip.
questions.option6: I do not have a student loan
